info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 7 at 8:34AM AKDT by NWS Fairbanks AK
info.description:
A very cold upper level Arctic low will be dropping south through the weekend. This will bring a much colder airmass to the area with snow levels slowly dropping to around 2500 feet across the Interior by Sunday night. Abundant moisture from a low in the Gulf of Alaska will bring rain and snow showers to the area. Accumulating snow is likely near Coldfoot, along the Richardson Highway through the Alaska Range, and across summits of the Dalton Highway, Ray Mountains, and White Mountains. Other areas above 1500 feet will see a mix of rain and snow, including along the Parks Highway near Denali National Park. Highs will struggle to break 45 degrees even in valleys from Friday through Sunday, so areas that don't see snow will see cold rain. Winds will also be breezy with gusts to around 25 mph.
Travelers should expect difficult travel conditions at times along portions of the Dalton Highway, over Eagle Summit along the Steese Highway, and along the Richardson Highway through the Alaska Range. Outdoor recreationists should be prepared for very chilly and wet conditions.

parameter.value: Wintry Weather Across High Terrain Through The Weekend

area.areaDesc: South Slopes Of The Eastern Brooks Range; South Slopes Of The Central Brooks Range; Upper Koyukuk Valley; Dalton Highway Summits; White Mountains and High Terrain South of the Yukon River; Northern Denali Borough; Southern Denali Borough; Eastern Alaska Range North of Trims Camp; Eastern Alaska Range South of Trims Camp
